Trije mrtvi niso bili dovolj za obsodbo
Razveljavili zaporno kazen 46-letnemu Aleksandru Žlendru. Sodeloval naj bi pri trojnem umoru sredi Beograda.
05 Nov 2019, 15:37 by Aleš Andlovič



Po sedmih mesecih negotovosti si lahko Žlender za nekaj časa oddahne. FOTO: Mia Media






Aleksander Žlender je po razglasitvi 15-letne sodbe spraševal, ali mora takoj v zapor. Mu bo sploh treba za rešetke? FOTO: Aleš Andlovič


MARIBOR – Sedem mesecev je 46-letni Aleksander Žlender živel v strahu, kdaj bo dobil poziv na prestajanje 15-letne zaporne kazni. Toliko mu je marca letos prisodila sodnica mariborskega okrožnega sodišča Andreja Lukeš, ker je pred 26 leti sodeloval pri trojnem umoru sredi Beograda. Toda pred dnevi si je vsaj za nekaj časa oddahnil, višji sodniki so namreč sesuli sodbo prvostopenjskega sodišča in zadevo vrnili v novo sojenje.Zagovornik Aleksandra Žlendra, odvetnik Franci Košar, je kmalu po koncu sojenja zatrjeval: »Glede na to, da je edini dokaz, na katerem temelji obsodba, izpoved storilca (Radovana Joksića, op. p.), in da ni prav nobenega drugega dokaza, ki bi kazal na to, da je bil obdolženi Žlender tistega dne v stanovanju žrtev, je po našem mnenju obsodba neutemeljena.« In res je mariborskemu odvetniku s pritožbo uspelo, sodbo so razveljavili, v zadevi pa se bo pet let in pol po začetku prvega sojenja začelo tretje dejanje.Četudi je od tragedije sredi srbske prestolnice minilo že vrsto let, še vedno odmeva. Kako tudi ne, ko pa je Radovan Joksić v stanovanju v Fruškogorski ulici umoril tri mlade ljudi. S pištolo škorpijon je ustrelil takrat 37-letnega podjetnika Nebojšo Salatića, njegovo 23-letno partnerico Slavico Kovačević in njenega 17-letnega nečaka. Dejanje je priznal in bil v Srbiji obsojen na najvišjo možno kazen: najprej dosmrtni zapor, s spremembo zakonodaje pa na 40 let zapora. Že ob prijetju leta 1995 je Joksić razkril, da dejanja ni izpeljal sam.
Izpoved kronske priče, da je prav Žlender ukazal trojni umor, ni zadostovala za obsodbo.
K podjetniku je prišel terjat denar skupaj z več pajdaši, glavni med njimi je bil po njegovih besedah Slovenec Aleksander Žlender. Joksić ga je obremenil, da ga je k trojnemu umoru napeljal on, ko ga je nadrl: »Kaj čakaš? Streljaj. Mrtva usta ne govorijo.« Zaradi te trditve in drugih dokazov, ki so jih zbrali srbski preiskovalci, so Srbi za Žlendrom razpisali mednarodno tiralico. Leta 2011 so ga slovenski organi pregona izsledili v Bistrici ob Dravi in mu odvzeli prostost. Srbi so zahtevali njegovo izročitev, a ga Slovenija ni predala, ker ima slovensko državljanstvo.Čeprav je imelo tožilstvo za sodelovanje Aleksandra Žlendra pri grozovitem zločinu bolj ali manj le en dokaz, priznanje


Aleksander Žlender je po razglasitvi 15-letne sodbe spraševal, ali mora takoj v zapor. Mu bo sploh treba za rešetke? FOTO: Aleš Andlovič

trikratnega morilca Radovana Joksića, pa gre vendarle za kronsko pričo. Joksića iz varnostnih razlogov niso prepeljali na zaslišanje v Slovenijo, je pa prek videokonference natančno opisal, kaj se je tragične noči dogajalo v Fruškogorski ulici sredi Beograda: »V hišo nas je šlo pet, žrtve, jaz in Žlender. V dnevni sobi sem sedel na usnjeno sedežno in jim rekel, naj ležejo na tla. Saša (tako so prijatelji klicali Žlendra, op. p.) je šel takrat v spalnico, ko je prišel iz nje, pa mi je rekel: 'Streljaj, kaj čakaš, mrtva usta ne govorijo'. Izvršil sem ukaz kot vojak, navajen sem bil tega, malo prej sem prišel z bojišča.«Ker mu je Žlender med zaslišanjem večkrat očital, d a ga želi po krivem obdolžiti, pa mu je Joksić odvrnil: »Vse je resnica in moja izjava ni bila podana pod nobeno grožnjo. Nimam razloga kogar koli po krivem obremenjevati, saj sem bil obsojen pred več kot dvajsetimi leti in tega ne morem več spremeniti.«

The three dead were not enough to convict
Imprisonment sentenced to 46-year-old Alexander Zhlander. He is expected to be involved in a triple murder in the middle of Belgrade.
05 Nov 2019, 15:37 by Aleš Andlovich



After seven months of uncertainty, Zlender can rest for a while. PHOTO: Mia Media






Following the announcement of the 15-year sentence, Alexander Zlender asked if he should go to prison immediately. Will he even need bars? PHOTO: Ales Andlovich


MARIBOR - For seven months, 46-year-old Alexander Zlender has lived in fear of when he will receive a 15-year prison sentence. He was awarded so much in March this year by Judge of the Maribor District Court, Andreja Lukeš, because he participated in a triple murder in the middle of Belgrade 26 years ago. But a few days ago he took a breather, and the higher justices in fact overturned the trial court's judgment and remanded the case back to the trial. On which the conviction, the confession of the perpetrator (Radovan Joksic, op. p.), is based, and that there is no other evidence to suggest that the accused Žlender was victim of the victim's apartment that day, the conviction is unfounded. "Indeed, the Maribor lawyer succeeded in appealing, the judgment was overturned, and the third act will begin in the case five and a half years after the first trial begins. Even though many years have passed since the tragedy in the Serbian capital, it is still echoing. How not to, however, when Radovan Joksic murdered three young people in an apartment in Fruška Gora Street. The scorpion shot a 37-year-old entrepreneur Nebojsa Salatic, his 23-year-old partner Slavica Kovacevic and her 17-year-old nephew with a gun. He acknowledged the act and was sentenced to the highest possible sentence in Serbia: first life imprisonment, with a change in the law to 40 years in prison. Even at the time of his arrest in 1995, Joksic revealed that he did not perform the act himself.
The testimony of the Crown witness that Zlender ordered the triple murder was not sufficient to convict.
The entrepreneur came to claim the money, along with several other mates, the chief among them was Slovenian Alexander Aleksander Zlender. Joksic charged him with leading him to triple murder when he scolded him: “What are you waiting for? Shoot. Dead mouths do not speak. ”Because of this claim and other evidence gathered by Serbian investigators, Serbs called for an international arrest warrant for Žlendrom. In 2011, he was tracked down by the Slovenian law enforcement authorities in Bistrica ob Dravi and arrested. The Serbs demanded his extradition, but Slovenia did not hand him over because he has Slovenian citizenship.

three-time killer Radovan Joksic, however, is a crown witness. Joksic was not transported for questioning to Slovenia for security reasons, but through a videoconference, he described exactly what was happening in the tragic night in Fruška Gora in the middle of Belgrade: “Five of us, the victims, myself and Zlender went to the house. In the living room, I sat on a leather seat and told them to lie on the floor. Sasha (that's what friends called Žlendra, op. P.) Went to the bedroom at the time when he came out of it, and told me: 'Shoot what are you waiting for, dead mouth is not talking'. I executed the order as a soldier, I was used to it, I came from the battlefield a little earlier. "As Zlender repeatedly accused him of wanting to blame him during his interrogation, Joksic replied:" Everything is true and my statement was not given under no threat. I have no reason to blame anyone, since I was convicted more than twenty years ago and I cannot change it anymore. "
